description: Retrieves information about the partitions in a table.

parameters.name: DatabaseName
parameters.description: The name of the catalog database where the partitions reside.

parameters.name: TableName
parameters.description: The name of the partitions' table.

parameters.name: Expression
parameters.description: An expression that filters the partitions to be returned. The expression uses SQL syntax similar to the SQL WHERE filter clause. The SQL statement parser JSQLParser parses the expression. Operators: The following are the operators that you can use in the Expression API call: = Checks whether the values of the two operands are equal; if yes, then the condition becomes true. Example: Assume --variable a' holds 10 and --variable b' holds 20. (a = b) is not true. < > Checks whether the values of two operands are equal; if the values are not equal, then the condition becomes true. Example: (a < > b) is true. > Checks whether the value of the left operand is greater than the value of the right operand; if yes, then the condition becomes true. Example: (a > b) is not true. < Checks whether the value of the left operand is less than the value of the right operand; if yes, then the condition becomes true. Example: (a < b) is true. >= Checks whether the value of the left operand is greater than or equal to the value of the right operand; if yes, then the condition becomes true. Example: (a >= b) is not true. <= Checks whether the value of the left operand is less than or equal to the value of the right operand; if yes, then the condition becomes true. Example: (a <= b) is true. AND, OR, IN, BETWEEN, LIKE, NOT, IS NULL Logical operators. Supported Partition Key Types: The following are the supported partition keys. string date timestamp int bigint long tinyint smallint decimal If an type is encountered that is not valid, an exception is thrown. The following list shows the valid operators on each type. When you define a crawler, the partitionKey type is created as a STRING, to be compatible with the catalog partitions. Sample API Call:

parameters.name: Segment
parameters.description: The segment of the table's partitions to scan in this request. The zero-based index number of the segment. For example, if the total number of segments is 4, SegmentNumber values range from 0 through 3. The total number of segments.

nested_params.name: SegmentNumber
nested_params.description: The zero-based index number of the segment. For example, if the total number of segments is 4, SegmentNumber values range from 0 through 3.

nested_items.name: Partitions
nested_items.description: A list of requested partitions.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The values of the partition.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the catalog database in which to create the partition.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the database table in which to create the partition.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the partition was created.

nested_items.name: LastAccessTime
nested_items.description: The last time at which the partition was accessed.

nested_items.name: StorageDescriptor
nested_items.description: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

nested_items.name: Columns
nested_items.description: A list of the Columns in the table.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Column.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The data type of the Column.

nested_items.name: Comment
nested_items.description: A free-form text comment.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: These key-value pairs define properties associated with the column.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The physical location of the table. By default, this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

nested_items.name: AdditionalLocations
nested_items.description: A list of locations that point to the path where a Delta table is located.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InputFormat
nested_items.description: The input format: SequenceFileInputFormat (binary), or TextInputFormat, or a custom format.

nested_items.name: OutputFormat
nested_items.description: The output format: SequenceFileOutputFormat (binary), or IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat, or a custom format.

nested_items.name: Compressed
nested_items.description: True if the data in the table is compressed, or False if not.

nested_items.name: NumberOfBuckets
nested_items.description: Must be specified if the table contains any dimension columns.

nested_items.name: SerdeInfo
nested_items.description: The serialization/deserialization (SerDe) information.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of the SerDe.

nested_items.name: SerializationLibrary
nested_items.description: Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: These key-value pairs define initialization parameters for the SerDe.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BucketColumns
nested_items.description: A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SortColumns
nested_items.description: A list specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

nested_items.name: Column
nested_items.description: The name of the column.

nested_items.name: SortOrder
nested_items.description: Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order ( == 1), or in descending order ( ==0).

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: The user-supplied properties in key-value form.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SkewedInfo
nested_items.description: The information about values that appear frequently in a column (skewed values).

nested_items.name: SkewedColumnNames
nested_items.description: A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SkewedColumnValues
nested_items.description: A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SkewedColumnValueLocationMaps
nested_items.description: A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StoredAsSubDirectories
nested_items.description: True if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or False if not.

nested_items.name: SchemaReference
nested_items.description: An object that references a schema stored in the Glue Schema Registry.

nested_items.name: SchemaArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema. One of SchemaArn or SchemaName has to be provided.

nested_items.name: SchemaName
nested_items.description: The name of the schema. One of SchemaArn or SchemaName has to be provided.

nested_items.name: RegistryName
nested_items.description: The name of the schema registry that contains the schema.

nested_items.name: SchemaVersionId
nested_items.description: The unique ID assigned to a version of the schema. Either this or the SchemaId has to be provided.

nested_items.name: SchemaVersionNumber
nested_items.description: The version number of the schema.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: These key-value pairs define partition parameters.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LastAnalyzedTime
nested_items.description: The last time at which column statistics were computed for this partition.

nested_items.name: CatalogId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the partition resides.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A continuation token, if the returned list of partitions does not include the last one.
